text: Kamal Desai (10 November 1928-17 June 2011) was an Indian novelist writing in Marathi. She was born in Yamkan Mardi in the Belgaum district. She studied in Belgaum, going on to complete a master's degree in Marathi at Bombay University. She lectured on Marathi at several universities in Maharashtra. Desai began writing in 1955. She later retired, moving to a small flat in Pune. She is perhaps best known for her 1975 novel Hat Ghalnari Bai (Woman Wearing a Hat). == Selected works == * Rang (Colours), stories (1962) * Ratrandin Amha Yuddhacha Prasang (We confront the war day and night), novel (1963) * Kala Surya (Dark sun), novel (1972) * Rang-2, stories (1998) == References == Category:1928 births Category:Year of death uncertain Category:Indian women novelists Category:Indian women short story writers Category:Marathi-language writers Category:People from Belgaum district Category:University of Mumbai alumni Category:20th-century Indian novelists Category:Women writers from Karnataka Category:20th-century Indian short story writers Category:Novelists from Karnataka Category:20th-century Indian women writers Category:20th-century Indian writers Category:2011 deaths
